title: katou_keiko
body:
Witch of the Fuso Army in the [[Witches Of Africa]].

Her appearance is tomboyish, with short brown hair and often seen with goggles worn on her head. She was sent to North Africa and soon joined with [[Hanna-Justina Marseille]]'s unit, forming the 31st Joint Fighter Squadron "Storm Witches". Being the ranking officer, Keiko became the Commanding Officer. She has the power of super eyesight, but due to her age and failing magic, Keiko mostly holds herself to an aerial recon role with her camera.

Has the pet name 'Kei'. Her weapons include [[arisaka|Type 38]], Type 97, and Type 98 rifles, Type 1 and ZB-26 machine guns,  and a M1934 pistol. Her familiar is the Ezo red fox, and she's based on Katou Shouiji.

title: battle_of_the_kerch_peninsula
body:
[b]The Battle of the Kerch Peninsula[/b], which commenced with the [[Soviet]] Kerch-Feodosia Landing Operation (Russian: Керченско-Феодосийская десантная операция, [i]Kerchensko-Feodosiyskaya desantnaya operatsiya[/i]) and ended with the [[germany|German]] Operation "Bustard Hunt" (German: Unternehmen Trappenjagd), was a [[World War II]] [[battle]] between "Erich von Manstein":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erich_von_Manstein 's German [[Wehrmacht]] and [[Romania]]n 11th Army and the Soviet Crimean Front forces in the Kerch Peninsula, in the eastern part of the Crimean Peninsula. 

It began on 26 December 1941, with an amphibious landing operation by two Soviet armies intended to break the [[Siege of Sevastopol]]. Axis forces first contained the Soviet beachhead throughout the winter and interdicted its naval supply lines through aerial bombing. From January through April, the Crimean Front launched repeated offensives against the 11th Army, all of which failed with heavy losses. The Red Army lost 352,000 men in the attacks, while the Axis suffered 24,120 casualties. Superior German artillery firepower was largely responsible for the Soviet debacle.

On 8 May 1942, the Axis struck with great force in a major counteroffensive codenamed Trappenjagd which concluded by around 19 May 1942 with the liquidation of the Soviet defending forces and [[victory]] for the Wehrmacht.

title: siege_of_odessa
body:
[b]The Siege of Odessa[/b], also known to the [[Soviet]]s as [b]The Defense of Odessa[/b], lasted from 8 August until 16 October 1941, during the early phase of "Operation Barbarossa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Barbarossa , the Axis invasion of the [[Soviet Union]] during [[World War II]].

Odessa was a port on the Black Sea in the Ukrainian SSR. On 22 June 1941, the Axis powers invaded the Soviet Union. In August, Odessa became a target of the [[Romania]]n 4th Army and elements of the German 11th Army. 

Due to the heavy resistance of the Soviet 9th Independent Army and the rapidly formed Separate Coastal Army, supported by the Black Sea Fleet, it took the Axis forces 73 days of siege and four assaults to take the city. Romanian forces suffered 93,000 casualties, against Red Army casualties estimated to be between 41,000 and 60,000.

The siege ended in a costly Axis victory, but the [[soviet_army|Red Army troops]] succesfully evacuated the region.

title: cattleya_(queen's_blade)
body:
[b]Cattleya[/b] (カトレア) is a [[Queen's Blade]] character. Voiced by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]], designed by [[Kaneko Hiraku]]. She is a blacksmith, weapons store owner and a former adventurer with [[huge breasts]]. She has black hair tied into a ponytail, blue eyes, and glasses. Fights with swords and spears. She entered the Queen's Blade tournament to find her missing husband. Has a young son named [[rana (queen's blade)|Rana]].

Rather unusually, Cattleya is one of, if not, the most popular character of the franchise, despite it featuring wide array of casts for general appeal. Primarily due to her volpulous and motherly appearance (to the point that one of her Pixiv tag is "120cm", referring to the official measurement of her [[huge breasts]]). Which lead into her being featured in numerous [[mature female|MILF]] works.

Cattleya's battle book: pool #743

h4. Variations

* [[weapon_merchant_cattleya|Cattleya (Weapon Merchant)]]

title: silpheed_(series)
body:
A series of [[starfighter]] combat video games. Created by Game Arts.

Silpheed is the main game in the series, featuring several different equipments, Base Infiltration and Boss Fights.

the Sega CD sequel retains most of the equipment on the first series, but in better used of a CG like pre-rendered animation while retaining the vertical shooter itself.

Silpheed: The Lost Planet; the story starts an invasion of an alien force, which all Silpheed spacecraft must save the galaxy against the occurrence of an unknown Alien lifeforms in the galaxy, this sequel is published by Capcom.

Project Sylpheed; is the successor of the Silpheed games but in the most Ace combat style of gameplay, the Sylpheed fighter is called the Delta Saber, which is similar to the SA-77 Silpheed from its previous appearances.

title: silpheed
body:
A [[science fiction]] space shooter [[video game]] developed by Game Arts and designed by Miyaji Takeshi.

It made its debut on the Japanese PC-8801 in 1986, and was ported to the Fujitsu FM-7 and MS-DOS formats soon after. It was later remade for the [[Sega CD]] in 1993 and has a sequel called [i]Silpheed: The Lost Planet[/i] released for the [[PlayStation 2]] in 2000.

[[Silpheed_(spaceship)|]] is the name of the [[spacecraft]] that the player controls. Like many shooter games, the story involves using the Silpheed as Earth's last effort to save itself from destruction by a powerful enemy invasion known as Xacalite.

the Gloire is the Mothership of the Invasion forces, as it written, only the Silpheed space fighter can destroy it and save the galaxy.

title: ginban_kaleidoscope
body:
[b]Ginban Kaleidoscope[/b] (Skating Rink Kaleidoscope) was a Japanese Romance Light novel that ran for 9 volumes from 2003 to 2006 and was later adapted into a 12 episode anime in 2005 by Studio Karaku, now known as Actas.

The plot follows [[Sakurano Tazusa]], a Japanese Olympic figure skating candidate, whose body gets inhabited by [[Pete Pumps]], a Canadian stunt pilot after he does during a stunt gone wrong at the same time when Tazusa was competing in Canada.

title: mortal_kombat_trilogy
body: The last classic [[Mortal Kombat (series)|]] game, using a variant of Ultimate Mortal Kombat 3's engine. title: toudou_naoya
body:
Main protagonist of [[Persona 1]], known as [b]The Pierced Boy[/b] in his debut game and [b]Boy with Earring[/b] in [[Persona 2]]. The manga adaptation calls him [b]Toudou Naoya[/b]. He is noted for his bluntness and natural-born leadership skills.

Fans tend to call him [b]Pierce[/b] (ピアス) after his full title in Japanese (ピアスの少年, [i]Piasu no Shounen[/i]).

His Persona is [[The Emperor (tarot)|]].

Follows directly after [[Mortal Kombat X]], and ends with the creation of a new timeline, which is the setting of [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)]].

Set 20 years after [[Mortal Kombat 9]], and followed by [[Mortal Kombat 11]].

title: mortal_kombat_9

title: galil_ace
body:
The [B]IWI Galil ACE[/B] is a series of [B][[assault rifle]]s[/B] and [B][[battle rifle]]s[/B] originally developed and manufactured by "Israel Weapon Industries":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Weapon_Industries]. Mainly available in three different calibers: 5.56×45mm NATO, 7.62×39mm and 7.62×51mm NATO. 

The design is based upon the original [[IMI Galil]], but has a modern design to increase its accuracy and lower its weight, while maintaining the original Galil's ergonomics, ease of maintenance and reliability under battle conditions.

h4. See also
* [[Kalashnikov rifle]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* Wikipedia: "IWI ACE":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IWI_ACE]

title: d1_grand_prix
body:
A Japanese [[car]] [[drifting]] [[racecar|motorsports]] series. Founded in 2001, the series eventually expanded internationally to have leagues in the United States, United Kingdom, Malaysia, and New Zealand. The US and UK leagues are both currently defunct, with the two regions having unrelated but still very popular drifting series in [[Formula Drift]] and European Drift Championship respectively.

Like [[Super GT]], D1GP is also notable for featuring [[race queen]]s despite their decreased presence in other motorsports.

title: autocycle
body:
A portmanteau of [i][[car|automobile]][/i] and [i][[motorcycle]][/i].  It is a US legal term referring to [[three-wheeler]]s that feature car-like steering, car-like passenger seating, and some degree of passenger compartment.  In the US they can not legally be classified a car, but a classification was needed to cover car-like three-wheelers that are different from motorcycle-like three-wheelers.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Three-wheeler - Registration":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three-wheeler#Registration]

title: two-fingered_typing
body:
[[Typing]] on a computer or typewriter keyboard using both index fingers. Better known as [i]Hunt and Peck[/i] typing due to most people who type in this manner being inexperienced with typing on a keyboard who must "hunt" for the key they're looking for and then will "peck" it with their index finger.  Some self-taught users may still use this type of typing even after having becoming familiar with the computer keyboard.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Typing - Techniques: Hunt and Peck":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typing#Hunt_and_peck]

title: deedlit
body:
CV: [[Touma Yumi]] (1990 OVA), Niiyama Shiho -> Noda Junko (after Niiyama's passing) (1998 anime)

Character from [[Record of Lodoss War]]. As a high [[Elf]], Deedlit is in touch with nature and draws from its essence for her magic, although she also excels at swordplay. Starting from the 1990 OVA, she falls in love with [[Parn (Lodoss)|Parn]] rather fast, and eventually starts dating him.

As with many other examples from [i]Lodoss[/i], Deedlit codified the appearance of elves in Japanese fantasy with her [[long pointy ears|long]] [[pointy ears]]. She also has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]].

body:

In prison, their skills were acknowledged by taking the top ranks in Prison Rap. Heavy rap is let out based on dissatisfaction to society and anger to its circumstances. They overwhelmed the stage with abundant individuality and a radical lyricism.

title: 1nm8_(paradox_live)
body:
A group of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

Three people who have an extremely high affinity for phantoms and can produce unique illusions. Kei, the leader of the group, used to be the center of VISTY, but left the group for one reason or another, and now the three of them live under one roof. The unworldly atmosphere that the three of them create moves the hearts of those who listen to them.

h6. Members:
* [[Miyama Kei]]
* [[Itsuki (paradox live)|]]
* [[Rokuta (paradox live)|]]

title: amprule_(paradox_live)
body:

2MCs consisting of Yeon Dongha, the younger brother of Hajun, and Baek Chungsung, the Yeon family butler. Crushing BAE’s Hajun in the phantom live and grabbing the mic to reign as the absolute champion. Their music features solemn and elegant tracks, and aggressive and poisonous lyrics.

h6. Members:
* [[Yeon Dongha]]
* [[Baek Chungsung]]

title: visty_(paradox_live)
body:
A group of singers in [[Paradox Live]].

An idol group who suffered a great fall from fame due to the sudden withdrawal of their center member at the height of their popularity. While each member excels in their abilities, they are left in the shadow of their loss, treated as leftovers. With everything to lose, these idols are betting it all on this one last chance to prove themselves.

h6. Members:
* [[Yamato Shogo]]
* [[Hikage Toma]]
* [[Kureha Aoi]]
* [[Misuji Kantaro]]

title: cozmez_(paradox_live)
body:
A duo of [[twins|twin]] [[brothers]] in [[Paradox Live]].

Orphans that grew up without knowing their parents’ faces. After escaping their orphanage, they survived by entering stage battles to earn prize money. They trust each other fully, having depended on the other's support to survive. Their songs call for empathy with downer, compelling, and realistic lyrics spun from their heavy upbringing.

h6. Members:

* [[Yatonokami Nayuta]]

title: abe_no_seimei_(onmyoji)
body:
Protagonist and playable character in [[Onmyoji]], based on historical figure Abe no Seimei.

An amnesiac but peerless [[onmyouji]] of the Heian period. Sophisticated and powerful, watches over the safety of the capital Heian-kyō, along fellow playable onmyoji [[Kagura (onmyoji)|]], [[Minamoto no Hiromasa (onmyoji)|Hiromasa]], [[Yao bikuni (onmyoji)|Yaobikuni]], and his various [[shikigami]].

Has [[blue eyes]] with red [[makeup]] around them, [[white hair|white]] [[long hair]] tied with a [[ribbon]]. Usually seen wearing a [[tate eboshi]], [[japanese clothes]] ([[kariginu]]) with [[long sleeves]], [[bridal gauntlets]] covered by [[prayer beads]] and carrying a [[folding fan]].

title: nightbird_(transformers)
body:
A female [[mecha]]'s name from the [[Transformers]] franchise that first appeared in an episode of the G1 TV series from 1984.

[b]Nightbird[/b] is a sentient female [[ninja]] or [i]kunoichi[/i] giant [[robot]] designed by a [[Japan]]ese [[scientist]] who was inspired by the [[autobot]] designs. In the original cartoon she is silent and never utters a word.

In the original cartoon she does not possess variable geometry and thus can't transform, though later incarnations of Nightbird are typically given a Cybertronian origin, allowing her to transform. In [[transformers: rise of the beasts|Rise of the Beasts]], her vehicle mode is a [[Nissan skyline r33|R33]] [[Nissan Skyline GT-R]].

title: sega_mega_drive_mini
body:
The [b]Sega Mega Drive Mini[/b], known as the [b]Sega Genesis Mini[/b] in regions outside of Japan, is a dedicated console modeled on the original [[Sega Mega Drive]] [[game console]] from 1988. It is published by [[SEGA]] and produced by [[m2_(company)|M2]]. 

The Mini emulates the original console's 16-bit hardware, and includes 42 games, all ported by M2. 

It was released in North America and [[Japan]] in September 2019, and in Europe and the Middle East the following month.

A second model with more games and a different external design was released in 2022.

title: 1943_the_battle_of_midway
body:
[b]1943: The [[Battle of Midway]][/b] is a 1987 shoot 'em up arcade game developed and published by Capcom. It was the first followup to Capcom's earlier [[1942 (game)|]].

[b]1943 Mark II: The Battle of Midway[/b] is an  "alternate" version of the original 1943.

The game is set in the Pacific theater of [[World War II]], off the coast of the Midway Atoll. The goal is to attack the Japanese Striking Force (機動部隊 [i]kidou butai[/i]), fly through the 16 stages of play, and make their way to the Japanese battleship Yamato and destroy her.

h5. List of Boss in stages

Stage 1: [[tone_(cruiser)|Tone]]
Stage 2: [[kaga_(aircraft_carrier)|Kaga]]
Stage 3: "Ayako":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_G8N] (亜也虎)
Stage 4: [[fusou_(battleship)|Fusou]]
Stage 5: [[akagi_(aircraft_carrier)|Akagi]]
Stage 6: [[ki-67|Daihiryuu]] (大飛龍)
Stage 7: [[ise_(battleship)|Ise]]
Stage 8: [[hiryuu_(aircraft_carrier)|Hiryuu]]
Stage 9: Ayako II
Stage 10: [[mutsu_(battleship)|Mutsu]]
Stage 11: [[ki-67 |Daihiryuu]]
Stage 12: [[souryuu_(aircraft_carrier)|Souryuu]]
Stage 13: [[yamashiro_(battleship)|Yamashiro]]
Stage 14: [[g10n_fukagu|Ayako III]] Post #2471145
Stage 15: [[nagato_(battleship)|Nagato]]
Stage 16: [[yamato_(battleship)|Yamato]]

title: senjou_no_ookami_ii
body:
[b]Senjō no Ōkami II[/b] (戦場の狼II, [b][i]Wolf of the Battlefield II[/i][/b]), also known as [b]MERCS[/b] outside [[Japan]], is a run and gun [[video game]] developed and published for the [[arcade]]s by [[Capcom]] in 1990. 

It is a sequel to the 1985 arcade video game hit [b]Commando[/b] (known as [[Senjou no Ookami]] in Japan). 

While not as successful as its predecessor, Mercs was well received by critics and was a moderate commercial success. It received a port for the [[Sega Mega Drive]] home console in 1991 and was followed by a downloadable game sequel called [[Wolf of the Battlefield: Commando 3]] in 2008.

body:
[[Mecha]] from [[Muv-Luv Alternative]]. The Type 94 Shiranui is a fully Japanese-produced [[tactical surface fighter]] and the first ever third-generation TSF introduced. While they're primarily used by Imperial Japanese forces, Shiranui models were also adopted by Japan-based UN forces.

The machine was used as the development base for the [[XFJ-01a Shiranui]].
other_names: 不知火(マブラヴオルタネイティヴ)

title: type_00_takemikazuchi
body:
[[Mecha]] from [[Muv-Luv Alternative]]. The Takemikazuchi is a 3rd generation [[tactical surface fighter]] utilized by the Empire of Japan and exclusively piloted by members of the Shogunate and the Imperial Royal Guard.

Four main variants of the unit exist in the series:
* [b]Type-00R[/b]: Usually blue or purple, features a set of eyes. The purple version is heavily featured in the series' promotional material.
* [b]Type-00F[/b]: Usually red or yellow, features an [[assault visor]]. Piloted by [[Tsukuyomi Mana]] in Alternative and [[Takamura Yui]] in [[muv-luv total eclipse|Total Eclipse]].
* [b]Type-00A[/b]: Painted in white, otherwise visibly identical to the 00F.
* [b]Type-00C[/b]: Painted in grey and a featuring a simplified head unit. Used by Imperial Guard pilots from commoner families.

title: kimi_ga_nozomu_eien
body:
Visual novel developed by âge and released in 2001. An anime adaptation aired in 2003, and an OVA adapting one of the VN's other routes was released between 2007 and 2008.

The series is set in the same continuity as [[Kimi ga Ita Kisetsu]] and [[Muv-Luv]], and has a short comedy-focused spinoff in [[Akane Maniax]].

The anime adaptation was licensed by Funmation in America, who released it under the title [b]Rumbling Hearts[/b]. An official English translation of the VN was announced in 2020, and the title of the release was later revealed to be [b]The Eternity You Desire[/b]. There is currently no set release window for the VN translation.

h4. Characters

title: cobra_(space_adventure_cobra)
body:
The titular character of [[Space Adventure Cobra]]. A famous space pirate that erased his own memories and got plastic surgery to change his face in an effort to put his dangerous life behind him. He suddenly begins to regain his memories, however, and begins his adventures anew. 

Best-known for his distinctive [[arm cannon]], the "[[Psychogun]]". It channels Cobra's mental energies into a laser beam that can be controlled freely. He has a prosthetic forearm to cover the cannon when not in use.

title: toasting_(gesture)
body:
A social custom in which a drink (usually of [[alcohol]]) is taken to honor a person or to celebrate an occasion. A toast may involve two people touching their [[drinking glass|drinking glasses]] together, or simply raising their glasses in the air.

A toast is often accompanied by a verbal expression, such as "Cheers!" in English, "Prost!" in German, or "Kanpai!" in Japanese.

h4. External links

title: macroich_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.

Designed by [[Gozu farm]].

Transient from the world of Tir na Nog. He's a second year student at the private Bukuro Academy in Ikebukuro, Toshima Ward. He is part of the kendo team and a giant who wields a two-sword style in the underground fight ring. He either self-imposes or is imposed with the behavioral conduct of a military man who complies with others' wills. As a result of that, in the past there were many who relied on him for power, which also resulted in many toying with his determination. But over in Ikebukuro where Fergus's memories and experiences are suitable for him, he seems to be glorifying the life of a student. Perhaps of his role as a prophet, there are occasions where he glimpses at fragments of memories of times not set in the present. Every time the pain that springs back up from the difference between love and friendship reappears, he repeats his misunderstanding as he wonders if it is some kind of vision. He is a man whose constant catchphrase is "youth" and sees dreams of an adolescence he cannot return to. He holds good will towards those who honor a single choice like he does. He has a strange, frequent connection to the number seven, the number before eight. Since he's lost a part of the memory of the person known as Fergus and their role, he often just calls himself mac Roich.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Mac-roich":[https://housamo.wiki/MacRoich]

[[Real life]] Japanese Thoroughbred race[[horse]], romanized name rendered as "Hell Shake". Sired by [[Hokko Tarumae (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Pisa no Meissen.

The horse was named after the [[Poptepipic]] character [[Hellshake Yano]]. When Hellshake's owner, the Yamaguchi Stable, put out a recruitment notice for a jockey, they specifically asked for one named Yano, resulting in the hire of [[Yano Takayuki]]. As such, most art featuring Hellshake (and Yano) skews towards referencing Poptepipic.

title: sasuke_(ninja_warrior)
body:
[i][b]Sasuke[/b][/i] is a sports entertainment reality competition where a number of contestants (typically 100) traverse a four-stage obstacle course. Each obstacle is designed to tax either a contestant's agility, quickness in feet, or upper body strength. A false move in passing the obstacle would make them fall into the water below. This culminates in a final stage composed of a rope climb to the top of a high platform in a given time limit. The competition is typically run in Japan as at least a three-hour show. Edited/Shortened versions are aired outside Japan under the title [i]Ninja Warrior[/i] (hence this tag's qualifier and later officially the show's subtitle) and several localized versions outside Japan have since made, some using the [i]Ninja Warrior[/i] name (e.g. [i]American Ninja Warrior[/i] and [i]Ninja Warrior UK[/i] to name two of the best known).

Named after the character [[Sarutobi Sasuke]].

title: russia
body:
A country located at the northern part of the Asia and eastern part of Europe. At 17,125,200 square kilometres (6,612,100 sq mi), it is the largest country in the world. Formerly, it was the core of the [[Soviet|Soviet Union]] from 1922 to 1991, and before that, the core of the [[Russian Empire]]. 

In 2022, President [[Vladimir Putin]] launched [[russo-ukrainian war|an invasion]] of neighboring country [[Ukraine]] to seek the "demilitarisation and denazification" of it.

title: help:autotags
body:
These tags are automatically added by the site. Most of these tags cannot be manually added or removed.

h4. Tags

h6. Resolution
* [[lowres]]: Both width and height are <= 500.
* [[highres]]: Either width is >= 1600 or height is >= 1200.
* [[absurdres]]: Either width is >= 3200 or height is >= 2400.
* [[incredibly absurdres]]: Either dimension is >= 10000.
* [[wide image]]: Image is at least 4x wider than it is tall, and the width is >= 1024.
* [[tall image]]: Image is at least 4x taller than it is wide, and the height is >= 1024.

h6. File type
* [[animated gif]]: A GIF that has 2 or more frames.
* [[animated png]]: A valid APNG file.
* [[flash]]: A Flash animation or game.
* [[video]]: A video in WebM or MP4 format.
* [[ugoira]]: An animation in the ugoira format used by Pixiv.
* [[exif rotation]]: An image with an EXIF flag set to rotate it.
* [[non-repeating animation]]: An [[animated]] image that loops under 10 times.
* [[greyscale]]: An image saved in the greyscale color space. Unreliable due to artists saving greyscale images in others color spaces.

h6. Audio

* [[sound]]: A [[video]] with audible sound (any sound louder than -70 dB).

h6. Sources

* [[non-web source]]: If the post contains a source that is not an http(s) link.
* [[bad link]]: If the post's source is recognized by Danbooru as a direct image URL rather than a link to a post.
* [[bad source]]: If the post's source is recognized by Danbooru but does not come from an image or post URL.

h6. Wildcard Implications

* [[cosplay]]: If the post is tagged with a "*_(cosplay)":/tags?search[name_matches]=*_(cosplay)&search[order]=count tag, the character and [[cosplay]] tags are added as well. For example, tagging [[hatsune miku (cosplay)]] automatically tags [[hatsune miku]] and [[cosplay]].
* [[school uniform]]: If the post is tagged with a "*_school_uniform":/tags?search[name_matches]=*_school_uniform&search[order]=count tag, the [[school uniform]] tag is added as well.
* [[meme]]: If the post is tagged with a "*_(meme)":/tags?search[name_matches]=*_(meme)&search[order]=count tag, the [[meme]] tag is added as well.

h4. Notes

* [[Wide image]] and [[tall image]] can be added and removed from posts that don't meet the criteria listed above, but they cannot be removed from posts that do.
* [[Animated]] and [[sound]] can only be added manually to [[Flash]] posts.
* [[Bad link]] and [[bad source]] are only automatically managed on sites that Danbooru supports. For other sites, they can be added or removed at will.
* [[Tagme]] is automatically added to posts with no non-auto tags, and automatically removed when a post has 30 tags. It can be added or removed at will otherwise.

title: help:imagesize
body:
There are numerous ways in which you can search posts by resolution and filesize.

h4. Resolution

* [[lowres]] - Both width and height are <= 500.
* [[highres]] - Either width is >= 1600 or height is >= 1200.
* [[absurdres]] - Either width is >= 3200 or height is >= 2400.
* [[incredibly absurdres]] - Either dimension is >= 10000.
* [[wide image]] - Image is at least 4x wider than it is tall, and the width is >= 1024.
* [[tall image]] - Image is at least 4x taller than it is wide, and the height is >= 1024.
* [code]width:[/code] - Search posts by image width.
* [code]height:[/code] - Search posts by image height.
* [code]mpixels:[/code] - Search posts by number of pixels.
* [code]ratio:[/code] - Search posts by width:height ratio.

h4. Filesize

* [code]filesize:[/code] Search posts by file size.

h4. Example searches using metatags

{{width:100}}
Search for posts with a width of 100 pixels.

{{height:100}}
Search for posts with a height of 100 pixels.

{{mpixels:5..}}
Search for posts with 5 million pixels or greater.

{{ratio:16:9}}
Search for posts with a width:height ratio of 16:9.

{{filesize:200kb..1.5m}}
Search for posts with a filesize between 200 kilobytes and 1.5 megabytes.

[quote]
See [[help:number_syntax|Number Syntax]] for an explanation of the number syntax used in the metatags.
[/quote]

h4. See also

* [[Help:Autotags]]: A list of all automatic tags.
* [[Help:Cheatsheet]]: A complete list of tags and metatags.
* [[Help:Number syntax]]: Information on searching using numbers.

title: howto:upload
body: This page has been moved to [[help:upload]].

title: howto:artstation
body:
ArtStation is an online platform for artists to upload and showcase their work.

This page will describe how to upload from ArtStation, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

h4. Uploading

The uploading process has been simplified for ArtStation. Upload with the "danbooru bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet], or paste in the URL of the work you wish to upload in the upload page. This way, you don't have to upload the image from your computer and risk it being an [[image sample]]. If you wish to upload a project with multiple images, the batch bookmarklet will make this much easier.

If after uploading the source is a direct image URL or blank, it should be changed to the HTML URL of the work. There are two types of HTML URL pages for projects on ArtStation. The www version represents the main site, in addition to pages based on a custom domain name for the artist. On the custom domain name gallery, the artist can make some images available not on the www gallery. Either URL should technically work and detect artist names, however the artist subdomain is able to be changed. Below is an example of a preferred source:

[code]
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/EJ6Jn
[/code]

You can observe that the alternative URL structure is simply borrowed from the other by comparing them, as shown below by the same project on the different pages.

[code]
https://deel.artstation.com/projects/EJ6Jn
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/EJ6Jn
[/code]

Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]].

h4. Artist naming and entry

If there are no other active accounts on which an artist posts, the name listed in their profile will usually be sufficient for their artist name. If their ArtStation account has been found linked from one their other accounts such as DeviantArt or Pixiv than their ArtStation URLs (seen below) should be appended to their existing artist entry. See "Artist tagging help":/forum_topics/8199 thread if you are unsure or think an artist name should be changed.

There are two URLs for an ArtStation artist that should be included in their artist entry list of URLs. One starts with www and the other is a customization subdomain. Unlike Pixiv however direct links to images should not be included. Below is an example for one artist:
* https://www.artstation.com/geosiador
* https://geosiador.artstation.com/

[b]Note[/b]: Artists on ArtStation are able to edit their usernames on the site. When this happens both the above URLs will change and should subsequently be added to their artist entry, however the old ones should not be removed.

Sometimes an artists other accounts may be listed in the About subheading on their ArtStation profile. This could help find an existing artist entry or should be appended to the artist's URL list.

h4. Legacy "/original/" files
At its launch, ArtStation had higher-resolution or quality version of images sometimes available. This allowed users to sometimes upload much higher quality versions of images form the source. Many images uploaded prior to suspension of this file thankfully remain on Danbooru as legacy content from that time, despite no longer being available from ArtStation. See below for the legacy instructions on uploading these images, which was later automated by the recommended bookmarklet:

[expand]
ArtStation has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[artstation sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here.

To find the full image URL, you must manually alter part of the image URL (typically [b]/large/[/b] or [b]/4k/[/b]) to [b]/original/[/b]. If the [b]/original/[/b] returns a [b]file not found[/b] error, then the [b]/4k/[/b] image is accepted as the original. Some small images have similar [b]/large/[/b] and [b]/4k/[/b] version, because check biggest quality.

URLs with different resolution:

[quote]
Original [tn](not always exist)[/tn]: https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/028/861/423/original/acorecell-cell-qn-1.jpg
Sample large resolution: https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/028/861/423/large/acorecell-cell-qn-1.jpg
Sample 4K resolution: https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/028/861/423/4k/acorecell-cell-qn-1.jpg
[/quote][/expand]

h4. See also

title: howto:drawcrowd
body:
Drawcrowd [tn](dead/closed)[/tn] is an online platform for artists to upload and showcase their work. It is one of the newest sources of images for Danbooru.

This page will describe how to upload from Drawcrowd, in addition to how to handle new artist entries in the case an entry doesn't already exist for the artist you're uploading a work from.

[b]As Drawcrowd is still new, it is important to read these instructions carefully.[/b] One of the peculiar intricacies about Drawcrowd is that the download button is misleading and does not download the actual, full and original image. The original images are kept hidden to mitigate bandwidth costs.

h4. Uploading

Here's the ideal procedure when uploading from Drawcrowd.
Drawcrowd has reduced-size versions of its images known as [[drawcrowd sample]]s, none of which should be uploaded here.

To find the full image URL, you must manually alter part of the image URL (typically [b]/large/[/b]) to [b]/original/[/b]. If the [b]/original/[/b] returns a [b]file not found[/b] error, then the [b]/large/[/b] image is accepted as the original.

[b]2.[/b] Change the source from the direct image URL to the HTML URL of the work.  It should look like the following:

[quote]
[nodtext]https://drawcrowd.com/projects/mtq1mtg5ltctmjatndq[/nodtext]
[/quote]

[b]3.[/b] Use the artist tag detected under [b]Related Tags[/b], if there is one. If there is none, you may refer to the rest of this article on how to choose an artist name and make an entry for them.

[b]4.[/b] Remember to [[howto:tag|tag]] the rest of your upload and follow the rest of the procedures under [[help:upload]].

h4. Artist naming and entry

If there are no other active accounts on which an artist posts, the name listed in their profile will usually be sufficient for their artist name. If their Drawcrowd account has been found linked from one their other accounts such as DeviantArt or Pixiv than their ArtStation URLs (seen below) should be appended to their existing artist entry. See "Artist tagging help":/forum_topics/8199 thread if you are unsure or think an artist name should be changed.

There is one URL for a Drawcrowd artist that should be included in their artist entry list of URLs. Below is an example for one artist:

* [nodtext]https://drawcrowd.com/liberea[/nodtext]

Sometimes an artists other accounts may be listed in the About subheading on their Drawcrowd profile. This could help find an existing artist entry or should be appended to the artist's URL list.

h4. See also

* [[drawcrowd sample]]
* [[bad drawcrowd id]]
* [[md5 mismatch]]

title: howto:ehentai
body:
"e-Hentai":http://e-hentai.org is a website that mainly hosts scans and digital versions of comics, artbooks, and doujinshis.
 
This page will describe how to upload from e-Hentai.

h4. Sourcing

The ideal procedure when uploading from e-Hentai is as follows.
 
1. [b]Under no circumstances is it recommended to upload from e-Hentai using image URLs.[/b] e-Hentai image URLs are extremely finicky, and trying to upload from e-Hentai using an image URL greatly increases your chances of uploading an [[e-hentai sample]].
 
2. Instead, download the image using the "Download original XXXX x YYYY X.XX MB source" button at the bottom of an image page, and then upload the file to Danbooru from your computer.
 
3. On the upload page, you can input the URL of the page containing the image, which should look as follows:

[quote]
https://e-hentai.org/s/4fbd8a7e43/1132165-7
[/quote]
 
4. Do not use gallery URLs as sources. Use gallery URLs in pool descriptions when pooling posts from a comic, artbook, or doujinshi uploaded from e-Hentai. Gallery URLs should look as follows:

[quote]
https://e-hentai.org/g/1132165/6a659287cf/
[/quote]

h4. Pooling

If you upload most or all of a comic, artbook, or doujinshi from e-Hentai, you should group your uploads into a pool. Your pool description should include the original name of the comic/artbook/doujinshi, a link to the corresponding e-Hentai gallery, and a short description of the material. Read [[help:pools]] for more info.

h4. See also

* [[e-hentai sample]]
* [[exhentai]]
* [[nhentai]]

title: izumi_sagiri
body:
[[eromanga_sensei|Eromanga-sensei]] character. The titular artist making illustrations for a light novel series made by her older stepbrother, [[izumi_masamune|Masamune]]. Sagiri's (Eromanga-sensei) illustrations are drawn by [[tiv]] for the anime.

She has [[grey hair|grey]] or [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[low-tied long hair]] fitted with [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]]s and [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[aqua eyes]]. Often seen in her [[pajamas]] or a blue [[jacket]], accompanied with a [[headset]], [[stylus]] and [[drawing_tablet|tablet]].

title: help:tag_subscriptions
body:
h4. Warning: This feature was "discontinued":[/forum_topics/13612] on February 1, 2017. Its functionality has been replaced by "saved searches":[/wiki_pages/83158].

With a [[help:users|Gold account]] you can subscribe to a group of tag searches. A background process runs once per day to refresh your tag subscriptions providing you a listing of the 200 most recent posts matching your searches. You can think of a tag subscription as a bookmark to a tag search, but coupled with the full power of Danbooru's tag query engine.

You can create up to five groups and each group can have up to 20 searches. Any search that works in the post listing will work with tag subscriptions, which means any metatag will work. You can even create tag subscriptions based on other people's tag subscriptions.

You can search your own tag subscriptions using the sub: metatag from the main post listing. To search for albert's tag subscriptions for example, search for [i]sub:albert[/i]. To search albert's touhou tag subscription group, you can search for [i]sub:albert:touhou[/i]. Because the posts are rendered through the main listing, you can also view the Atom feed, the Piclens feed, and all API calls will work as expected. And like any other metatag, you can combine it with other tags (to a degree).

Each search should go on a separate line. So if you put two tags on the same line, it will only match posts with both those tags. But if you put two tags on separate lines, it will match posts with either of the two tags.

To edit your tag subscriptions, visit your "tag subscriptions":/tag_subscriptions page.

title: help:tag_scripts
body:
Tag scripts allow you to quickly add and remove tags to posts by clicking on their thumbnails. You can add tags, remove tags, change ratings, and more. Only Gold-level and above users can use tag scripts.

To start tag scripting, first change the Mode dropdown box (beneath the Search box) to "Tag script" mode. Type the tag(s) you want to add or remove in the text field that appears. After that, simply click on each post thumbnail you want to apply the tags to.

You can have up to 10 tag scripts at once. To change between them, use the number keys (be sure to deselect the tag script input box first). A notification will be displayed confirming which tag script is active. 

The best way to illustrate how tag scripts work is through examples:

* [b]cat[/b] would add the [[cat]] tag to the post.
* [b]cat dog[/b] would add both the [[cat]] and [[dog]] tags.
* [b]-cat -dog[/b] would remove the cat and dog tags.
* [b]cat -dog[/b] would add the cat tag and remove the dog tag.
* [b]rating:e[/b] would change the post's rating to explicit.
* [b]pool:Disgustingly_Adorable[/b] would add the post to the Disgustingly Adorable pool.
* [b]fav:me[/b] would favorite the post.
* [b]-fav:me[/b] would unfavorite the post.

See [[help:cheatsheet]] for a list of other metatags you can use with tag scripts.

title: help:comments
body:
h4. Rules

See the list of rules in [[help:community_rules|Community Rules]]. In short:

* Don't insult or abuse other users.
* Don't use hate speech or racist or sexist slurs.
* Don't post unmarked spoilers.
* Don't delete and repost comments to avoid downvotes.
* Don't engage in vote manipulation. This includes creating multiple accounts to vote multiple times, or mass downvoting a user's comments to harass them.
* Write comments in English.

If a comment contains spam or breaks the rules, you can use the Report button to report it to the moderators.

h4. Formatting

All comments are formatted using [[help:dtext|DText]].

h4. Voting

Comments may be upvoted or downvoted. By default, comments with a score of -4 or lower are greyed out, and comments with a score of -8 or lower are hidden. You may adjust this threshold by changing the "Comment threshold" setting in your "account settings":[/settings].

h4. Search

You can use the "comment search page":/comments/search to search for comments by their text, the commenter, and/or the tags on the post the comment belongs to.

You can also use these searches to find posts with comments:

* {{vocaloid comments:>0}} (Vocaloid posts that have comments)
* {{vocaloid order:comment}} (Vocaloid posts, ordered by most recently commented on)
* {{vocaloid order:comment_count}} (Vocaloid posts, ordered by most comments)
* {{comment:"hatsune miku"}} (posts with a comment containing the phrase "Hatsune Miku")
* {{commenter:MD_Anonymous}} (posts commented on by MD_Anonymous)

h4. Moderation

Moderators can view all upvotes and downvotes on comments.

Moderators can view deleted comments. Don't delete and repost your own comments to avoid downvotes.

Moderators can sticky comments by checking the "Sticky" box. Stickied comments are highlighted and are never hidden by downvotes.

title: help:forum
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Overview":[#dtext-overview]
* "Format":[#dtext-format]
* "Rules":[#dtext-rules]
* "Search":[#dtext-search]
* "Categories":[#dtext-category]
* "Reporting":[#dtext-report]
* "Return":[#dtext-return]
[/expand]

h4#overview. Overview

The forum is the place for discussions related to Danbooru.

h4#format. Formatting

All forum posts are formatted using "DText":/static/dtext_help.

h4#rules. Read the Rules Before Proceeding

* "[b]The Community Guidelines[/b]":[/help/community_rules/]
* Old, legacy forum rules:
** "Rules - Read this before making a thread":[/forum/show/14897/]
** "Civility on the Forum":[/forum/show/57304/]

h4#search. Forum Search

The quick search bar will search through the body only. For more advanced searching, use the "forum post search page":/forum_posts/search, which also allows searching by topic title, author name, and topic category.

h4#category. Forum Categories

Currently, the following categories exist for forum topics:
* "[b]General[/b]":[/forum_topics?search%5Bcategory_id%5D=0]: The default category, for anything that does not fit the other categories.
* "[b]Tags[/b]":[/forum_topics?search%5Bcategory_id%5D=1]: Discussions about new or repopulated tags, tag changes, tag aliases and implications, etc.
** Additionally, you can "request a bulk update":[/bulk_update_requests/new] there.
* "[b]Bugs & Features[/b]":[/forum_topics?search%5Bcategory_id%5D=2]: Discussions related to the Danbooru software (example bugs/inconsistencies or missing features, etc).
** Additionally, you can report bugs or request features at "the Github repository":[https://github.com/r888888888/danbooru/].

h4#report. Reporting

If you believe that a forum post either contains spam or breaks "the Community Guidelines":[/help/community_rules/], you can report it to "the Moderators":/users?commit=Search&search%5Bmin_level%5D=40&search%5Border%5D=date. To report a forum post, click on [b]Report[/b] at the bottom of each forum post. Please enter a valid reason.

h4#return. Go Back

* "Return to Forum":/help/toc#dtext-forum
* "Return to the Table of Contents":/help/toc
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":/help/home

title: help:metatags

Metatags are tags that convey information about an image outside of what is visible in it.

For a list of metatags, see [[tag group:metatags]].

title: help:pixiv_api
body:
h4.Unofficial API specification https://www.snip2code.com/Snippet/798193/Unofficial-API-specification-extracted-f h4.Intro TODO: Document Pixiv's new Public API. See issue #2383 for some information. Pixiv offers an API, called the Public API. It uses OAuth for authentication and JSON for responses. h4. Authentication https://oauth.secure.pixiv.net/auth/token TODO h4. Requests You must include the "Authorization" header with the value "Bearer {ACCESS_TOKEN}", where {ACCESS_TOKEN} is what you received during the authentication step. Make a GET request to the below URL to get information on the work with ID {ILLUST_ID}: [code] https://public-api.secure.pixiv.net/v1/works/{ILLUST_ID}.json [/code] Valid GET parameters known: [b]image_sizes[/b] A comma-delimited list of which sizes of the image URLs you want returned to you. Currently known allowed values: small, medium, large, px_128x128, px_480mw (large refers to the biggest size, /img-original/) [b]profile_image_sizes[/b] A comma-delimited list of which sizes of the artist's avatar URLs you want returned to you. Currently known allowed values: px_170x170, px_50x50 [b]include_stats[/b] Whether to include statistics such as view count for the image or not. Can be: true, false [expand=Example results][code] { "status":"success", "response":[ { "id":49270482, "title":"ツイログ", "caption":null, "tags":[ "神崎蘭子", "双葉杏", "アイドルマスターシンデレラガールズ", "Star!!", "アイマス5000users入り" ], "tools":[ "CLIP STUDIO PAINT" ], "image_urls":{ "large":"http://i3.pixiv.net/img-original/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p0.jpg" }, "width":1200, "height":951, "stats":{ "scored_count":8247, "score":81697, "views_count":191630, "favorited_count":{ "public":7804, "private":745 }, "commented_count":182 }, "publicity":0, "age_limit":"all-age", "created_time":"2015-03-14 17:53:32", "reuploaded_time":"2015-03-14 17:53:32", "user":{ "id":341433, "account":"nardack", "name":"Nardack", "is_following":false, "is_follower":false, "is_friend":false, "is_premium":null, "profile_image_urls":{ "px_50x50":"http://i1.pixiv.net/img19/profile/nardack/846482_s.jpg" }, "stats":null, "profile":null }, "is_manga":true, "is_liked":false, "favorite_id":0, "page_count":2, "book_style":"none", "type":"illustration", "metadata":{ "pages":[ { "image_urls":{ "large":"http://i3.pixiv.net/img-original/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p0.jpg", "medium":"http://i3.pixiv.net/c/1200x1200/img-master/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p0_master1200.jpg" } }, { "image_urls":{ "large":"http://i3.pixiv.net/img-original/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p1.jpg", "medium":"http://i3.pixiv.net/c/1200x1200/img-master/img/2015/03/14/17/53/32/49270482_p1_master1200.jpg" } } ] }, "content_type":null } ], "count":1 } [/code][/expand] See "here":https://gist.github.com/ZipFile/e14ff1a7e6d01456188a for a more complete listing of URLs you can request and their responses. h4. Old API For information on Pixiv's old Smart Phone API, which was removed on May 11th, 2015, see below. [expand=Obsolete SPAPI] Pixiv offers an API through several URLs: [code] http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/illust.php?illust_id={IDLIST} # individual images (comma-delimited list of IDs) http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/manga.php?illust_id={ID} # list of each page of a manga separately http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # individual novel (does not support list of IDs) http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/new_illust.php # list of newest posts on pixiv http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/new_novel.php # list of newest novels on pixiv http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/new_novel_r18.php # list of newest R-18 novels on pixiv http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark_user_new_novel.php # list of newest novels from users you have bookmarked http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/mypixiv_new_novel.php # list of newest novels from your friends http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/ranking.php?mode={day/week/month} # daily/weekly/monthly ranking http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/search.php?s_mode={SEARCHMODE}&word={QUERY} # search http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/search_user.php?nick={USERNAME} # search users http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/member_illust.php?id={USERID} # view posts by specific user http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/member_novel.php?id={USERID} # view novels by specific user http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/illust_comments.php?illust_id={ID} # view comments on an image http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_comments.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # view comments on a novel http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/user.php # returns the current user http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/user.php?level={1|2|3} # returns the current user. increasing level parameter increases the number of fields returned. http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/mypixiv_all.php?id={USER_ID} # friends list http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark.php?id={USER_ID}&rest={show|hide} # bookmarked images. rest=show mean public, rest=hide means private. http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark_novel.php?id={USER_ID}&rest={show|hide} # bookmarked novels http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/bookmark_user_all.php?id={USER_ID}&rest={show|hide} # bookmarked users http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_text.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # body of this novel http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_series.php?series_id={SERIES_ID} # list of novels in this series http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_bookmarks.php?id={NOVEL_ID} # list of users who bookmarked this novel http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/novel_marker_all.php http://spapi.pixiv.net/iphone/hot_tags.php [/code] The PHPSESSID parameter from your login cookie should be included in the query to access R-18 content. If you append &c_mode=count to the end, you'll receive the number of results returned by that search instead of the results themselves. If you append &p={PAGE} you can change pages. There are 50 results per page. For images that have been deleted (i.e., bad id), or if you query for a R-18 image but don't pass a valid PHPSESSID, the API returns a "200 OK" HTTP code but an empty response. Private images (MyPicks, etc...) have an illust id of 0 and a generic thumbnail. Responses are unlabeled CSV documents. title: help:pawoo_api
body:
For up to date details on the Pawoo API, see https://github.com/pixiv/mastodon. h4. Set up a Pawoo account To access the API on Pawoo, you must have a Pawoo account. See [[Howto:Pawoo]] for details. h4. Get an access token Perform a GET using your credentials to any Pawoo /web url, e.g. [nodtext]https://pawoo.net/web/accounts/$ID_NUMBER[/nodtext], where $ID_NUMBER is the account ID. This can even be your own account ID. Scrape the HTML for the JSON. This can be done using the following regex: [code] [/code] After importing the JSON, grab the access token using the [code]['meta']['access_token'][/code] key. h4. title: howto:yandere
body:
"Yande.re":[https://yande.re] is an anime art board running "Moebooru":[https://github.com/moebooru/moebooru], a heavily-modified fork of the Danbooru 1 software. Sometimes, you may want to upload an image from Yande.re to Danbooru.

h4. When to upload

If the image was posted to Yande.re from another site, such as the artist's Pixiv or homepage, and that page is still available, upload from that site instead. Only upload from Yande.re if it is a [[scan]]. On Yande.re, pictures that aren't scans should have a Source field, while scans do not, but you can double-check by using a "reverse image search":[/wiki_pages/67137#dtext-reverse-image].

h4. Uploading

h5. Fullsize image

Pasting the yande.re link (example: https://yande.re/post/show/1073271) into danbooru's upload box will lead to danbooru automatically fetching the highest quality version from yande.re. Alternatively, you can use the "bookmarklet":[/static/bookmarklet] on the yande.re post page. 

[b]Note:[/b] Yande.re contains posts greater than 100MB in filesize (example: https://yande.re/post/show/1086192). These are currently not uploadable to danbooru.  Under those circumstances, using the next best image is allowed.  This will be the JPEG version if it exists, and the SAMPLE image if it does not.  See [b]Image Link Format[/b] below for an explanation of those terms.

h4. Maintentance

h5. Post source

The image URL may look strange (for example, it may contain a long list of tags at the end) but don't adjust it; After upload, Danbooru will automatically display a prettified version as the source if you leave it as-is.

title: garreg_mach_monastery_uniform
body:
The uniform used for the students from the Garreg Mach Monastery’s Officers Academy in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

It comes in several small variations that adapt to each student's personality, common elements include a [[long_sleeves|long sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[black coat]] or a [[black dress]] with [[gold trim]], a [[white neckerchief]], a [[high-waist_skirt|high-waist]] [[black skirt]] and a [[black vest]].

The House Leaders additionally include a [[cape]] in their uniform, being, [[red cape|red]], [[blue cape|blue]] or [[yellow cape|yellow]] depending the Class they belong.

title: stove
body:
A kitchen appliance that is related to the oven. It is an enclosed space that is heated with fire or coals in order to cook food or heat a room.
Known in Japan as 焜炉/コンロ ([i]konro[/i]) or ガス台. For the device called stove in Japan, see [[heater]].

h4. Types

* [[Portable stove]]

h5. Cooking and heating (note: not all versions of these are intended for cooking)

* [[Kerosene heater]]
* [[Potbelly stove]]
* [[Wood-burning stove]]

h4. Additional equipment

* [[Fish grill]] (an integrated grill/broiler in some Japanese stove tops)
* [[Kitchen range]] (an appliance that integrates a stove top with an [[oven]])

title: kannazuki_sora
body:
Taimanin, the child of a retired Taimanin who married a normal human. When she was little, she lived a peaceful, ordinary life, but her parents were murdered by demons who had a grudge against her Taimanin mother and she was sold to the Chaos Arena.

She lived in fear, not knowing Taimanins, demons, or any evil of the world, but was rescued a few days later by a Taimanin force that attacked the Chaos Arena by surprise. Because of the trauma normal life has become hard and she was taken in by Gosha Village. 

She is an [[Action Taimanin]] original character

title: waterful_ring-toss
body: A water-based ring toss toy developed by Tomy during the 1970s. Upon being filled with water, players press a button on the side, which forces air through a tube into the main compartment and sends the rings flying. Many consider it a piece of childhood nostalgia given that it required a degree of skill to set all rings onto the pegs. Variants were developed and sold by Milton Bradley and other companies.

title: thermite_grenade
body:
A type of [[explosive|hand]] [[grenade]] designed for anti-materiel destructive purpose. It contains incendiary aluminum powder and metal oxides that can produce devastating heat (approximately 2500°C) when ignited.

It is well-known in [[Apex Legends]], identifiable by the red coloring and distinct shape.
While in real life many thermite grenades have same external shape as [[smoke grenade]]s, tubular casing with a [[grenade pin|pin]] but features different markings.

In the book/anime, everybody around her fears her because of her unusual appearance and the fact that her name also sound very close to [[Yamamura Sadako]] from [[The Ring]]. People would even call her Sadako, either by accident or on purpose.

Her motto is "A good deed a day," but it's usually hard for her due to the fact everybody runs away screaming whenever they see her.

title: minaret
body:
A [b]minaret[/b] is a type of [[tower]] typically built into or adjacent to [[mosque]]s. Minarets are generally used to project the Muslim call to prayer (adhan), but they also served as landmarks. They can have a variety of forms, from thick, squat towers to soaring, pencil-thin [[spire]]s.

For similar counterpart found on churches or cathedrals, see [[steeple]].

h1. See also

* [[Middle Eastern architecture]]

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2020_summer)
body:
The 2020 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] summer version of [[Hatsune Miku]].

The theme for this year was "Festival". Due to the 2020 Summer Olympics taking place around the same time that Magical Mirai would usually take place, the concerts this year were moved to late Autumn. Thus this year's Magical Mirai Miku received a summer and winter version, both designed by [[Fuzichoco]].

The summer version of Miku has a traditional Japanese theme with a pink, aqua, and black color palette. She wears a festive [[yukata]] with very [[wide sleeves]], pink and aqua [[bowtie|bowties]], and a [[single thighhigh]]. She carries a black [[folding fan]] and has a ring of floating [[drum|drums]] and [[speaker|speakers]] with [[cherry blossom print]] behind her.

The theme song this year was [[aisarenakute_mo_kimi_ga_iru_(vocaloid)|Aisarenakute mo kimi ga iru]] by [[Pinocchio-P]].

h4. Official art
* Main Visual: post #3776901
* Character Sheet: post #4005613

h4. See also
* [[Magical Mirai Miku (2020 Winter)]]
* [[Magical Mirai Miku]]
* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2020_winter)
body:
The 2020 [[Magical Mirai (Vocaloid)|]] winter version of [[Hatsune Miku]].

The theme for this year was "Festival". Due to the 2020 Summer Olympics taking place around the same time that Magical Mirai would usually take place, the concerts this year were moved to late Autumn. Thus this year's Magical Mirai Miku received a summer and winter version, both designed by [[Fuzichoco]].

The winter version of Miku has a fur-trimmed, pastel pink, blue, and white theme. She wears a [[fur-trimmed dress]] with very wide shawl-like sleeves, pastel pink and blue [[bowtie|bowties]], [[mismatched gloves|mismatched]] pink and blue gloves, and a [[single thighhigh]] with [[star print]]. A chest (also called coffer or kist) is a form of furniture typically of a rectangular structure with a hinged lid on top, used for storage, often associated with treasure and other valuables. The interior space may be subdivided. 

[b]Not to be confused[/b] with [[crate]], chests tend to have more ornate design and crates have removable lid.

title: nasal_cannula
body:
The [b]nasal cannula[/b] is a device used to deliver supplemental oxygen or increased airflow to a patient or person in need of respiratory help. It consists of a lightweight elastic tube which on one end splits into two prongs which are placed in the nostrils and from which a mixture of air and oxygen flows.

title: iv_stand
body: The pole for hanging the bag(s) for an [[intravenous drip]] or [[blood bag|blood]] transfusion. The stereotypical IV stand generally has a distinctive pair of curlicued hooks at the top, and is usually wheeled so that the patient can bring it along when moving about.  Some are height-adjustable for use when sitting or standing.  They can also be built into/attached to [[hospital]] beds, gurneys, or wheelchairs.

title: ghost_of_tsushima
body:
[b]Ghost of Tsushima[/b] is a 2020 action and adventure [[video game]] developed by "Sucker Punch Productions":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sucker_Punch_Productions and published by [[Sony]] Interactive Entertainment. The player controls [[Sakai Jin]], a [[samurai]] on a quest to protect Tsushima Island during the "first Mongol invasion":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mongol_invasions_of_Japan#First_invasion_(1274) of [[Japan]]. 

Jin must choose between following the warrior code to fight honorably, or using practical but dishonorable methods of repelling the Mongols with minimal casualties. The game features a large open world which can be explored either on foot or on horseback. When facing enemies, the player can choose to engage in a direct confrontation using Jin's [[katana]] or to become a legendary warrior known as "the Ghost" by using stealth tactics to assassinate opponents. 

Sucker Punch began developing the game  in 2014 with a heavy emphasis on melee combat. The studio collaborated with "Japan Studio":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Studio and visited Tsushima Island twice to ensure that the game was as culturally and historically authentic as possible. The team was heavily inspired by samurai cinema, particularly films directed by "Kurosawa Akira":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akira_Kurosawa , as well as the comic book series [[Usagi Yojimbo]]. The game's landscape and minimalistic art style were influenced by [[Shadow of the Colossus]], and locations in the game were designed to be "the perfect photographer's dream". While the in-game landmass is similar in shape to "Tsushima Island":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsushima_Island , the team did not intend to create a one-to-one recreation. Ilan Eshkeri and Umebayashi Shigeru composed the game's soundtrack.

The game was released for [[PlayStation 4]] in July 2020, and an expanded version for PlayStation 4 and [[PlayStation 5]], subtitled Director's Cut and featuring the "Iki Island":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iki_Island expansion, was released in August 2021. A multiplayer mode titled Ghost of Tsushima: Legends was released in October 2020 and made available separately in September 2021.

The game received positive reviews upon release, with critics praising the game's melee combat, story, characters, performances, and music, though it received some criticism for its implementations of stealth gameplay and open world structure. The game was a commercial success, selling more than 9.73 million copies by July 2022 and was one of Sony's fastest-selling original games. It was nominated for several end-of-the-year awards, including Game of the Year at The Game Awards 2020 and 24th Annual D.I.C.E. Awards. A film adaptation is in development as of 2022.

title: nakai_hisao
body:
[[katawa_shoujo|Katawa Shoujo]]'s protagonist.

Hisao is a male high school student with arrhythmia. In the prologue he collapses from a heart attack after receiving a confession from the girl he likes. He is detained for several months in a hospital, during which they break off relations.  

Due to his condition, Hisao cannot return to a normal high school. Instead he is transfered to Yamaku High School, a school for the disabled.

Hisao's main hobby is reading, which was his sole escape from the boredom of staying in the hospital. Before his heart attack, he also used to play soccer casually with friends.

Hisao has [[brown eyes]] and [[messy hair|messy]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. He usually wears the [[Yamaku high school uniform]]; when in casual clothes he is usually wearing a distinctive-looking [[sweater vest]] with a grey checkerboard pattern. His chest has a [[scar]] from heart surgery, though how noticeable it is varies by artist.

title: muv-luv:_dimensions
body:
A [[Muv-Luv Alternative]] gacha game for smartphones, released on March 17, 2022. The game was pulled from storefronts within 48 hours of launching due to severe technical issues, and relaunched on July 11, 2023.

Originally announced and launched as [b]Immortals: Muv-Luv Alternative[/b], it was rebranded to MuvLuv: Dimensions prior to relaunching.

The game is set in an alternate universe from the rest of the franchise, where an international PMC called Immortals leads mankind's fight against the [[Beta (muv-luv)|B.E.T.A.]] in the year 20XX. This alternate setting has allowed the game to feature characters from different time periods and countries of the original works as part of the same force.

title: weather_vane
body:
An instrument for showing the direction of the wind.

They are typically used as an architectural ornament to the highest point of a building. Although partly functional, weather vanes are generally decorative, often featuring the traditional cockerel design with letters indicating the points of the compass. The word 'vane' comes from the Anglo-Saxon word 'fane' meaning 'flag'.

h4. See Also
* [[Stevenson screen]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Weather vane":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weather_vane

title: stevenson_screen
body:
A Stevenson screen, sometimes referred to as an instrument shelter, is a shelter placed on exposed weather equipment to protect the instruments from the elements.

The most common model is a free-standing box design with a slanted roof, though other designs exist. They also have rows of slats on the sides called louvers which are designed to allow air to pass through, similar to the slats on window blinds.

h4. See Also

title: ladies_versus_butlers!
body:
Ladies versus Butlers! (れでぃ×ばと! Redi×Bato!) is a Japanese light novel series written by Tsukasa Kōzuki, with accompanying illustrations by [[munyuu|Munyū]]. The series includes 13 novels released between September 2006 and March 2012, published by ASCII Media Works under their Dengeki Bunko imprint.

A manga adaptation by the illustrator group Nekoyashiki-Nekomaru was serialized in ASCII Media Works' Dengeki Moeoh magazine between the June 2008 and December 2008 issues. A drama CD based on the novels was released in September 2009. A 12-episode anime adaptation produced by Xebec and directed by Atsushi Ōtsuki aired in Japan between January and March 2010. The anime has been licensed by Media Blasters for release in North America.

* Adoration - a [[the euro front|Euro Front]] story following Imperial Royal Guard cadet [[Makabe Seijuurou]] on a military exchange trip to Dover Base.

title: muv-luv_unlimited:_the_day_after
body:
A [[Muv-Luv]] spinoff set after the end of [i]MuvLuv Unlimited[/i], continuing the events of that continuity after the original VN's ending. The entries in this subseries were originally released as part of [[Muv-Luv Alternative Chronicles]], but were later released as standalone titles on Steam.

Series creator Yoshimune Kouki has stated that the upcoming visual novel [[Muv-Luv Resonative]] will be the finale to this saga.
other_names: マブラヴアンリミテッドザ・デイアフター

title: muv-luv_alternative_(anime)
body:
The anime adaptation of [[Muv-Luv Alternative]], which features a completely different art style from the visual novel and an entirely new voice cast. The new cast has effectively replaced the original VAs, as the anime cast reprised their roles in [[Project MIKHAIL]] and are planned to continue doing so for any future projects featuring the original characters.

It initially ran from October 7 to December 22, 2021 and a second season began airing in October 2022.

The anime is closer to the manga adaptation than the original VN, as it includes several manga-original scenes and characters (such as [[Komaki Sayoko]]).

This tag should be used for posts that feature or reference anime-original aspects such as:
* the character and/or [[fortified suit]] redesigns
* [[Voice actor|seiyuu]] related posts based on the new voice cast
* characters and events introduced in the anime-original first episode 
* direct references to the adaptation's version of plot events
* any [[official art|official]], [[promotional art|promotional]], or [[production art]] related to the anime

h1. External Links
* "Official Website":[https://muv-luv-alternative-anime.com/]
* "Official Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Muv_Luv_A_anime]

title: muv-luv_alternative
body:
[[Science fiction]] visual novel by âge, and the third part of the original [[Muv-Luv]] trilogy. After the events of Muv-Luv Unlimited, [[Shirogane Takeru]] awakens in his room once again, though this time with his memories from Unlimited.

Alternative is the most well regarded and popular part of the series, and the original VN inspired several spin-offs and sidestories including [[Muv-luv Total Eclipse|Total Eclipse]], [[The Euro Front]], [[Schwarzesmarken]], and [[muv-luv alternative strike Frontier|Strike Frontier]]. 

A manga adaptation illustrated by [[Makishima Azusa]] was published from August 21, 2007 to April 27, 2017. This adaptation added extra scenes from other characters' points of view that were not present in the original VN. An [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|anime adaptation]] began airing in 2021, with two games ([[Project MIKHAIL]] and [[Muv-luv: Dimensions|Immortals: Muv-Luv Alternative]]) launching to accompany it.

h4. See Also
* [[fortified suit]]
* [[tactical surface fighter]]
* [[Try to scream... and I'll choke you with my breasts (meme)]]
other_names: マブラヴオルタネイティヴ

title: shirogane_takeru
body:
Protagonist of [[Muv-Luv]] and [[Muv-Luv Alternative]].

Takeru was voiced by [[Hoshi Souichirou]] up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to newcomer seiyuu Kamiki Kouichi. He's voiced by "Stephen Fu":[https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/Stephen-Fu/] in [[Project MIKHAIL]]'s English dub.

title: sakaki_chizuru
body:
Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. Class rep of [[Shirogane Takeru]]'s class, who often confronts him over his tardiness and lazy attitude towards school work. She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twin braids]] with [[parted bangs]]. She also wears [[glasses]] and has notably [[thick eyebrows]].

She is almost always at odds with [[Ayamine Kei]].

Chizuru was voiced by [[Kurata Masayo]] up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to [[Itou Miku]]. She's voiced by "Brittany Lauda":[https://www.behindthevoiceactors.com/Brittany-Lauda/] in [[Project MIKHAIL]]'s English dub.

title: mitsurugi_meiya
body:
A character from [[Muv-Luv]]. A rich girl and heir to the Mitsurugi Financial Group who suddenly moves in with [[Shirogane Takeru]] and proclaims her love for him in front of their entire class. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair|hair]], usually worn in a [[long hair|long]] [[ponytail]], and she is often seen with a [[katana]].

Meiya was voiced by Okushima Kazumi up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to Nanami Karin. She's voiced by [[Kira Buckland]] in [[Project MIKHAIL]]'s English dub.

title: tamase_miki
body: Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. A small, cat-like girl in [[Shirogane Takeru]]'s class who is often treated as the class pet by their classmates. She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] worn in [[twintails]] with [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]] and [[hair ears]], and she is often seen wearing a [[neck bell]] and [[cat tail]].

title: project_mikhail
body:
A [[Muv-Luv Alternative]] [[mecha]] action game released for Steam in early access on November 1, 2021. A [[Nintendo Switch]] version is planned for the game's final release.

The English release lists the game as [b]Project MIKHAIL: A Muv-Luv War Story[/b]. It is the first (and currently only) release in the franchise to feature English dubbing for the original VN's cast.

title: ayamine_kei
body:
Character from [[Muv-Luv]]. A girl of few words in [[Shirogane Takeru]]'s class, known for often cutting class and her love of [[yakisoba]]. She has [[purple eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]], and has the [[large breasts|largest breasts]] of the main cast.

She is almost always at odds with [[Sakaki Chizuru]].

title: try_to_scream..._and_i'll_choke_you_with_my_breasts_(meme)
body:
[[Meme]] referencing a panel from the manga adaptation of [[Muv-Luv Alternative]]. In the original panel, [[Ayamine Kei]] [[kabedon]]s [[Shirogane Takeru]] while covering his mouth, with the dialogue "Try to scream... and I'll choke you with my breasts." 

h4. See Also
* "The original panel":[https://cdn.donmai.us/original/65/52/6552990580f2147e15e3b28748afea53.jpg]

title: pac-man_(game)
body:
A classic, influential and very popular [[Japan]]ese [[arcade]] [[video game]] designed by "Iwatani Toru":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toru_Iwatani], published by [[Namco]] and first released in Japan on May 22, 1980. 

In 1982, [[Atari]] Inc. of America released the first game console version of the game for its [[Atari 2600]] console. It received bad reviews, but nevertheless, managed to become the best selling Atari 2600 game of all time; it sold an estimated 7 million copies, and was considered the best-selling home video game of all time when it was released

body:
A form of physical punishment in which a bundle of leafless twigs bound together, called a birch rod, is used to strike a person's buttocks, back, or shoulders.

Despite being named a birch rod, the rod is composed of several twigs bundled together and does not have to be composed of [[birch tree]] twigs.

body: A [[plant]] on which [[banana]]s grow. It is not an actual tree due to non-woody stem despite the size and has very large [[leaf|leaves]].

title: mesa
body:
An isolated, distinctly flat-topped [[hill]] or [[mountain]] that stands above the surrounding plains. They tend to be surrounded by steeply eroded [[cliff|cliffs]] on all sides. Mesas are usually found in arid, hot and dry regions where rock layers are horizontal.

As part of the natural landscape in the Southwestern United States, mesas are a common sight in [[cowboy western]] settings.

h4.See also
* [[canyon]]
* [[desert]]
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]

title: tundra
body:
A vast, flat, almost treeless cold biome found in Arctic region of Europe, Asia, and North America in which the subsoil is permanently frozen. Most of the vegetations there are low-growing [[plant]]s such as [[moss]] or few [[flower]]s. 

h1. See also
* [[nature]]
* [[plain]]
* [[snow]]
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]

title: monster_truck
body:
A monster truck is a specialized off-road vehicle with heavy suspensions, four-wheel steering, and oversized tires designed for competition and entertainment uses.  Monster trucks are either purpose built or modified from existing vehicles.  Modified vehicles are commonly light-duty trucks, such as [[pickup truck]]s, or [[sports utility vehicle]]s, but many other types of motor vehicles can be made into a monster truck like [[car]]s and even school buses.

title: promotions_(meme)
body:
An imageboard [[meme]] that involves a picture with a person's arms spread wide in triumph. 

The joke was based on the fact that people who posted porn in SFW imageboards would inevitably garnering more attention, and that the one whose their post is getting "promoted" to NSFW category (i.e the poster) should have known better.

title: chimney
body:

For the similar object found on industrial plants, locomotives or ships, use [[smokestack]] instead.

title: soulcalibur_vi
body:
The seventh entry in the mainline [[SoulCalibur|Soul]] franchise published by [[Namco]]. Instead of continuing the timeline laid out in previous titles, the game positions itself as a soft reboot for the setting, offering a retelling of the events of SoulCalibur 1 with potentially some changed details, including new and returning characters not otherwise seen in the original game. This is evidenced by the initial trailers and gameplay demos showing off a young Mitsurugi and a living Sophitia. The game released worldwide on October 18, 2018 for XBOX One, Playstation 4, and PC (Steam).

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_2
body:
The second main installment of the [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]][/i] series.

After the events of [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 1]][/i], ex-yakuza, [[Kiryu Kazuma]] is dragged back into Japan's underworld to help put a stop to a war between the Toujou Clan and Oumi Alliance instigated by [[Goda Ryuji]], who Kiryuu develops an intense rivalry for. Kiryuu is also helped by new allies such as [[Dojima Daigo]] and Sayama Kaoru.

A remake of [i]Ryuu ga Gotoku 2[/i], using the Dragon Engine seen in [i][[Ryuu ga Gotoku 6]][/i], was released in 2017 under the title [i]Ryuu ga Gotoku Kiwami 2[/i].

Also known as:
[i]Yakuza 2[/i]
[i]Yakuza Kiwami 2[/i]

title: adachi_koichi
body:
